CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 3, 1953, p. 4, reads: "Weil Pupils Make Exhibit For Foundling Home - Pupils of the sixth grade art classes at A. Leo Weil School constructed this elaborately designed manager scene showing the birth of Christ and it was exhibited at the Roselia Foundling Home on Bedford Avenue during the Christmas week.  The exhibit also included a large, painted wall-size mural.  Left to right are Juanita Fountain, Joseph Lewis, Cheryl Goosby, Ronald Smith, George Woody, Mrs. Catherine Venditti, the art class instructor; Henry Harvey, science teacher, and Sister James Regis. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Sister James Regis, George Woody, Ronald Smith, teacher Catherine Venditti, Juanita Fountain, Joseph Lewis, teacher Henry Harvey, and Cheryl Goosby gathered around nativity in Roselia Foundling Home
